Description: Egyptian terracotta figurine, possibly of an african male, in 'grotesque' style. Mould-made and solid. Beige-yellow Nile silt clay. Head only.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Ptolemaic, 3rd or 2nd century BC parallels from Naukratis (British Museum (GR1886,0401.1427, GR1886,0401.1428, GR1886,0401.1412, EA1976,0724.2; Walters 1903, C 625; Bailey 2008, 151, pl. 106, nos 3573-3578; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford no. G 107; Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, GR40.1887). One Naukratis parallel may be from the same mould series (Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery & Museum 1895.1.f). Egyptian comparanda, include similar examples dated 3rd to 2nd century BC (Török 1995, no. 241; Fischer 1994, no. 431, no. 437) and from a third century BC context at Athribis (Szymańska and Babraj 2004, 35, fig. 7). There are also similar 2nd century BC examples from Smyrna in Asia Minor (Burn & Higgins 2001, pl.71-2, no.2396-2404). See also 2nd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2000, Fig. 2). Szymańska, H. 2000. Tell Atrib excavations, 1999. In PAM II: 77-82. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Szymańska, H. & Babraj, K. 2004. 'Aus den Brennöfen von Athribis (Ägypten): Neue Funde aus dem Ptolemäischen Stadtviertel', in Antike Welt 35.2: 33-7. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.513) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
